resources.string: The #1 Thing To Remember With Meetings
Which is the core principle you have to remember with meetings?
It is important to go to every single meeting, especially as junior engineer
They are inherently expensive, as they are a pure usage of time
They are necessary for status updates
True or false: It is safer to just keep attending a meeting series, even if you are not clear exactly what value you are getting from it.
You have a meeting series where there is always action, but there is always an awkward portion at the end where people run out of topics. What should you do?
Decrease the length of the meeting
Delete the meeting
Invite more people to the meeting, so you have more to talk about
True or false: When in doubt of a meeting\'s value prop, just delete it. You can always bring it back later.
You have a 1 on 1 meeting series, and by the time of the meeting, you feel like there are a lot of issues that you two are getting to too late. What should you do?
Decrease the length of the meeting
Increase the frequency of the meeting
Push for the team to work on projects more slowly
Making Every Single Meeting You Have Effective
What do you absolutely need to with every single meeting in order to make it effective?
Talk a lot
Tell people what to do
Have a goal or set of goals for that meeting to achieve
What is the most important question you should be asking yourself constantly during a meeting?
Did someone say something wrong that I need to call out?
Is the meeting achieving its goal(s)?
How do I talk more during this meeting?
The Most Straightforward Way To Level Up Your Meetings
What is the most straightforward way to level up a meeting?
Make it longer
Write down what happens in the meeting and maintain a running set of notes
Invite more people in leadership roles to the meeting
True or false: Maintaining a good set of meeting notes can help you substantially with promotion.
Which of the following are benefits of maintaining meeting notes?
It helps you remember what happened during the meeting
It allows you to reflect on how useful a meeting series is
It shows that you care a lot about the meeting and the people within it
Taking Amazing Meeting Notes
For any meeting, what should you make sure for it?
It is clear who is responsible for taking notes
That everyone on the meeting invite is coming
That at least 5 people are on the meeting if it is a team meeting
True or false: As long as you write down most of what was said in a meeting, you have taken a good set of meeting notes.
What can you do when someone else in a meeting says something really insightful?
Stop paying attention to the meeting, so you can write it down
Stop the meeting and ask them to send an email to the entire team with that insight
Call out how you found what they just said to be very valuable and ask them for a bit of time so you can write it down
Your meeting is winding down, and you have a good set of notes of what was said during the meeting. What should you do next?
Your job is done. Tune out of the meeting
Work with the meeting group to convert what was covered in the meeting into concrete action items
Check your emails to see what you missed during the meeting
A Simple Trick To Make Your Meetings More Efficient
What can you do before a meeting to empower it to achieve more outcomes?
Meditate
Get free donuts for everyone in the meeting
Write down an agenda with discussion topics and seed it into the meeting notes document
You write down an agenda for your upcoming meeting, and you realize that it is incredibly rich and complex. What else can you do to level up the meeting?
Nothing, an agenda is all you need
Come up with some funny stories to tell during the meeting
Let everyone else on the meeting know that you have seeded it with an agenda, and you would appreciate them going through the agenda beforehand
1 on 1 Meetings Are An Exercise In Proactivity
Why should you err on the side of creating a 1 on 1 meeting instead of waiting for it to be absolutely necessary?
They are relatively cheap as they only consume the time of 2 people
1 on 1 meetings are crucial to functioning optimally within a team due to their deep relationship-building nature
The consequences of not having a 1 on 1 meeting when you should have had one are often really painful
True or false: Team meetings are more important than 1 on 1 meetings, so you should create them more aggressively for everyone to stay in sync.
Common Scenarios For Setting Up 1 on 1s
What is the main condition to look out for that could prompt you to set up new 1 on 1 meetings?
New people entering your work ecosystem
Needing a lot of executives to like you, so you set up meetings with them to get promoted
You are bored and just want people to talk to
Which of the following scenarios is something you probably should set up some new 1 on 1 meetings for?
You are joining a new team
New members are joining your team
You need to work with a new team cross functionally
Build The Relationship
Why should you build the relationship in 1 on 1 meetings?
The more intimate nature makes it especially effective for earning social capital
It helps pass the time
So they can help debug your code
True or false: Small talk is okay in 1 on 1 meetings to break the ice and learn more about the other person\'s life outside of work.
Why are deep relationships needed in tech, especially at senior levels?
When things get hard or go wrong, your earned trust will lead to these people having your back
So you can play politics effectively and exclude your enemies
So you can get more lenient code reviews
Be Awkward
Why should you be awkward and even a little bit uncomfortable in 1 on 1 meetings?
1 on 1 meetings are inherently a very inefficient way of conveying information, so you should take the opportunity to talk about more real, heavy-hitting topics
True growth happens when you are uncomfortable
The transparency helps build the relationship
True or false: 1 on 1 meetings are great for staying in sync, so status updates are one of the best things you can talk about during them.
Which of the following are good things to talk about in 1 on 1 meetings?
Feedback to improve
How you are feeling
The struggles you are facing, both inside and outside of work
Structuring Your Manager 1 on 1
If you are working in a strong, high-growth tech company, what is a good frequency to meet with your manager?
Once a day
Once every 1-2 weeks
Once every 1-2 months
True or false: Managers are extremely busy, so it is best to have ad-hoc 1 on 1 meetings with them based on whenever they are able to find a sliver of free time.
What To Do If Your Manager Keeps Canceling Your 1 on 1s
Your manager keeps canceling your 1 on 1s due to a perceived lack of discussion topics, even though you always have a lot to talk about. What do you do?
Nothing, just talk with someone else instead
Fill in a detailed, well-articulated agenda before each 1 on 1 and share it with your manager prior to the meeting
Complain to the manager of your manager
Your manager cancels your upcoming 1 on 1 meeting due to an unexpected, new fire that they have to deal with. However, you have a lot of important issues to talk about. What do you do?
Nothing, just wait for the next 1 on 1 as this is just how things are sometimes
Tell them that you understand the need to deal with fires and that you really value your time together. Proactively find a new time later in the week and move the 1 on 1 there
Tell your manager that they should just ignore the fire as things break all the time
Why Delayed And Infrequent Manager 1 on 1s Are Like Procrastination
True or false: Delayed and infrequent manager 1 on 1s can seriously affect your career growth long-term.
Why is it crucial to have frequent, consistent 1 on 1 meetings with your manager?
It forces you two to think about serious, longer-term issues like your personal career growth
It is vital towards building up this crucial work relationships=
It maintains the quality of your work life as it prevents work problems from festering over time
Having The Proper Mentality For Manager 1 on 1s
True or false: Your manager is your superior, so it is on them to ask the right questions and figure out what you need in your 1 on 1 meetings. You just need to show up on time.
Why is the burden on you to set the agenda and overall plan with your manager 1 on 1s?
Your manager is not a mind reader. Only you truly know your own needs
Your manager is likely very busy and their mind space is split up among multiple reports. Since you only have 1 manager, you are better positioned to bring focus to the meeting
Creating plans and direction setting are vital skills for growing in tech
True or false: It is better for your career growth to view your manager as being a resource for you instead of you being a resource for your manager.
True or false: A good manager 1 on 1 involves you giving status updates and then waiting for instruction on what to do next.
The Manager 1 on 1 Is A Litmus Test For Seniority
True or false: In tech, operating at senior levels means that you are driving more, if not most, of the conversation in your manager 1 on 1s.
Why do senior employees tend to drive more of the conversation in manager 1 on 1 meetings?
Because they really like talking
A mark of seniority is defining your own work, as opposed to someone telling you what to do
Managers do not have as much to say in meetings with senior reports
Make Sure To Get This Resource From Your Manager 1 on 1s
True or false: Your performance review result should not be a surprise, and the manager 1 on 1 is an instrumental mechanism towards ensuring that.
What are some ways to get the feedback flowing in a manager 1 on 1?
Share your wins
Share an observation about a specific project or other aspect of your work life where you feel like you could improve
Ask how you are trending overall performance-wise every few months
True or false: A simple [Do you have any feedback for me?] is a good way to ask for feedback from your manager.
You Should Be Vulnerable With Your Manager
You are feeling burnt out at work. Should you share this with your manager?
Yes, they can help decrease your workload and de-stress
No, sharing this is a sign of weakness. It is on you to figure out how you can work more efficiently.
You feel like you are slower than your other teammates and are afraid that you look bad amongst the team. Should you share this with your manager?
Yes, this is a case of imposter syndrome and your manager can help with this
No, you simply need to work harder to catch up to the rest of your team
Your dog just died, and you are having a really tough time concentrating at work because of this. Should you share this with your manager?
Yes, your manager is responsible for your well-being and should be receptive to your current state
No, this is a personal issue and you should keep it completely separate from your work life. Hide your pain and prevent your manager from finding out you have a personal issue whatsoever
